by ac- tivity, expected the best results from the new campaign, while Prince Andrew on the con- trary, taking no part in the war and secretly regretting this, saw only the dark side. 
On February 26, 1807, the old prince set off on one of his circuits. Prince Andrew remained 
at Bald Hills as usual during his father's ab- sence. Little Nicholas had been unwell for four days. The coachman who had driven the old prince to town returned bringing papers and letters for Prince Andrew.
